content:
ber 21, 2015
												I finally made it into the enemies trench, after running through a no man's land filled with gunfire, explosions and imminent death. Me and the few soldiers that made it into the trench now are  highground, the enemies main trench is below us, connected through a narrow path. I put my mashine gun on top of a small sandbag barricade and open fire on the enemy below us. They seek cover first and then shoot back, willing to drive us out of their trench. It's no use, their blue helmet make good targets along the dark mud and moldy planks, and they drop dead within seconds. My comrades start charging forward. I stay behind, giving them cover if needed. They run down, making it into the main trench without resistance. I wait a few seconds, then decide to catch up to them, as there are no targets for me anymore. I put my mashine gun aside, and instead take out my Luger. I start running down, my comrades in sight. Suddenly, I hear several shots and see my allies falling to the ground. Alerted, I stop moving and aim my luger around nervously. A french soldier suddenly runs past me. He notices me too late, I give off three shots in his direction, two shots hit him in the chest and he drops to the floor. "Five shots left in the magazine", I think, just before another enemy soldier comes from the other side, his rifle aimed straight at me. I panic, and empty the rest of my magazine in his direction, while he fires his rifle at me. I manage to hit im in the arm once, his shot luckily misses me. He takes cover again. I't dawns on me that my magazine is empty, and that he come out of his cover any second to finish the job. I head back, going up the path I came from as fast as I can. The path is narrow and small, there's no way he will miss this shot. Suddenly, I hear the sound of a german rifle next to me. Another soldier must have made it through the no man's land while our enemy was too busy fighting us off. I see my chance and run back to the hillside fortification while the enemy seeks cover from the rifle fire of my comrade. I make myself as small as I can, and try toreload, hands still shaking. I once again hear rifle fire, and see how my comrade makes his way back into our small sanctuary. I don't know if he managed to kill him or not, but at that point I don't even care anymore. I grab a magazine and put it into my Luger, when suddely a french soldier jumps in from above and stabs his bayonet right into the chest of my saviour. The magazine is in place, and I pull back the lock to avenge my fallen comrade, but it's too late: The soldier runs toward me, and before I can pull the trigger, he stabs his bayonet in my chest.Probably the most intense shooter I've ever played, 10/10 would get stabbed during reloading again.

I reload and get to the top of the parapet just in time to see two french squads charging towards me to retake the trench. I take aim an fire.10/10 would get PTSD again.This new update completes the game. Get it now.

content:
27, 2016
												I f***ing love this game. It's so goddarn good. It takes place back in the 1900's (1914-1918) where they had The First World-War... And there are like 4 game modes in Verdun... but i have only played one out of them... (The frontlines) Where you have to chose which side you are on... (German strosstruppen, British tommies and French poilus) however The french poilus are allianced with the British tommies... so there are only two sides in this game. But that is like how The First World-War Turned out like... they had some alliances with some other countries... but those sides... have not been invented in this game yet... But M2H Blackmill Games really made a good job with making this game so far... because the Graphics, Music, The quality, The atmosphere and the HUD-system really brings out how it may have been in a war before... but nah... it had been worse in real life because well... people died... lol. Because in games you respawn after you have died... just like in this game and many others.I really like how they have made so if you try to run out of the gunfight and war you get executed for deserting. And if you get tangled in barbed wire you have to get it off very easily or else you will die... but the problem is... you are a great target for anyone on the other side to get a good shot on ya... and when you give commands... whichever side you are on they will say the commands in their language. And the orders you get in this game makes everything so much harder... because you can see on the map which places you can't go to... because they count as deserting soldiers and when the enemies try to smoke you, you can put on a gasmask by pressing "4". and you can chose out of 4 different soldiers and 7 squads in this game. The soldiers however are:----------------------------------Corporal.Rifleman.Gunner.Bomber.This game is so good at creating feelings for me at least... lol. when you run out in the frontlines shooting, bombing, slaughter everyone out there and til at last dying over and over...makes me wanna give this game 8,7 out of 10. because after a while it can get a little monotonous... but still it's a really great game. Buy it... no matter the cost... you will not regret it. :3

content:
ber 2, 2014
VerdunVerdun is a WWI fps that places you in trench warfare.  This game is unique in that it is one of the few WWI games offered and that it is trench warfare and not just an open map yo run around and shot everyone.  The game is designed on the Unity engine and looks decent.  The engine provides good physic effects which makes the experiences that much more enjoyable.  Developement CycleThe graphics and gameplay have improved a lot over the last year.  The developers have released several patches since I made this video in June, 2014.  The game plays and looks better today than in my initial video review but still feels last gen.  Improvements have been made in areas like bullet trajectory/hit boxes which was a huge improvement needed in this game.  The GoodThe game brings a unique gameplay/experience in a very competitive war FPS genre.  Playing a WWI game is very cool to experience as most World War games are based on WW2 or something  sci-fy. The Devs really hit the mark in providing a trench war experience. I really enjoy playing this game. The BadMy biggest dislike is a lack of maps/battle locations. But unfortunately, this is a realistic game based on the actual WWI battle of Verdun so more maps is most likely not going to happen. ConculsionIs it worth your time? If you like the idea of playing a WWI game in the trenches of Verdun then yes I do. I really like this game and recommend it for any fan of war themed first-person shooters.  


Verdun: Beta First Impressions - PC Extra 
A Video of 
By: Volt

			This is a video of me playing Verdun for the first time. Verdun is a squad-based multiplayer FPS in a realistic WW1 setting inspired by the battle of Verdun in 1916.		





Verdun Back into the Trenches 
A Video of Verdun
By: Volt

			This is a quick video revisiting Verdun after several updates to the game. Verdun is a first person shooter based in a WWI trench warfare environment. I hope you like the video.		


My YouTube pageIf you like the video, please subscribe!  I am just starting out and am trying to build subscribers.  Thanks!https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLIBDbmeuGv7azek0i4ieUthojYsjC3c4z

												Verdun is a great game that hits that sweet spot between realism and annoying ease. The squad system makes the game unique and encourages you to build relationships with the people you're playing with. Unlike most FPS games, there's a lot of patience and tactics that go into attacking AND defending, and if you don't like to wait around, you may not like this game. However, if you have a group of friends who enjoys squad play, this is a great game to get.The biggest downside to the game is the lack of player base; I would also like to see some different game modes, and I hope to see those in the future. At $22, it's a fair price. On sale, it's a steal.

The magazine is in place, and I pull back the lock to avenge my fallen comrade, but it's too late: The soldier runs toward me, and before I can pull the trigger, he stabs his bayonet in my chest.Probably the most intense shooter I've ever played, 10/10 would get stabbed during reloading again.

												Verdun is an immensely fun game with a dedicated and friendly playerbase. The graphics are beautiful and the maps and trenches are very detailed. There are team deathmatch and free for all modes but they are not played as much by the playerbase.

												Before buying this game, ask yourself:Do you like being shot by people you didn't or can't see?Do you like being shot by people you thought were a stump or rock?Do you like getting your limbs blown off by explosions?Do you like getting shot from afar, or perhaps mowed down by a machingun?Do you like getting disemboweled on a bayonet?If you answered no to all those questions like a normal sane human being- TOO BAD BUY THE GAME AND PLAY IT ANYWAY! content:
3, 2015
												Finally a good World War 1 game! Experience the great war with all the bolt action, trench warfare, chemical weapon fighting you want! As of this review there are a deathmatch and Front lines. The Front lines game mode requires a little bit more explaining. I am going to quote the wiki here for you guys new to the game. "Frontlines is the most popular type of match played in Verdun. It is a competition between two teams, one French and one German. Each team has up to sixteen players. Each team is divided into squads of up to four players. The teams alternate between offense and defense ("Attack" vs "Defend"). While on offense the team can score a point by capturing the next trench. If the defending team is able to successfully defend their trench from the attack, then they earn a point. The match ends when one team controls the entire map or the timer runs out. "There is a lot of detail put into Verdun, but it does have a small playerbase at the moment. The game itself reminds me a bit of the Red Orchestra games in a World War 1 setting. Overall I have got to say I really recommend Verdun, its just got what it takes to be a great game!

Early Access Review
								Good to finally see a WW1 fps, this seems to be specially aimed for a niche so I would recommend the devs to bet on details for the historical realism and other factors of major importance such as weather and battlefield (i.e.: wind and mud were hugely influencial). But also important not to overload and stay niche and realistic, focusing on trench ambience too (I would like to see trenches that would make you feel like you dont wanna be there, darker, tighter, deeper, smellier with shattered muddy/bloody corpses with human rejects and lots of flies and the random mice). CONS:-Sync... which ruins everything but hope it gets fixed.-Matchmaking. Being on a battle with 1 vs 12 is ridiculous. Also extending the capacity of numbers of players in battlefield would feel closer to the actual events.-The ammount of bullets you take to battle is ridiculously unreal.

content:
ry 29, 2016
												If you want WW1 trench combat, this is basically the only game you can get. Thankfully it's a good game. Classes feel mostly balanced and maps are mostly decent. There are obviously good maps and bad maps. The majority of the maps are good but some are still absolute stinkers (looking at you Fort Douaumont). Verdun feels mostly finished, but there are some things still missing such as only the British character models have gask masks, missing sounds, iffy netcode, reload animations don't sync with audio.. etc. It's all nit-picky stuff, apart from the netcode issue. The core gameplay is bug free and solid and I can only suggest a couple of improvements (i.e. one I really want is having an indicatior if your bolt isn't positioned correctly since the gun model always has a closed bolt even if the game thinks the bolt is open).I've been playing Verdun on both Windows and Linux and as expected, performance is utter trash on Linux. Maybe with some tweaking and better drivers the game will perform better, but bad performance is a common theme for me and games in Linux. Crashes are extremely frequent on Linux but I've never experienced a crash on Windows 10.

content:
10, 2015
												The game is amazing. The amount of thought and care the developers put into this game is admirable. They have a weekly blog where they communicate with fans, and are a breath of fresh air when it comes to video game dev's. Since I started playing the game has gone through many changes, most recently the Horrors of War expansion pack, which nearly doubled the amount of content in the game for  no cost at all. Gameplay:The game works by having 2 teams of 16, separated into 4 squads of 4. Each squad member has a specific role and a choice of 3 loadouts that contour to those roles with a unique type of offmap support for each of the NCOs to use.. There are a few kinds of Squads as well: Theres the basic infantry squad consisting of an NCO, Marksman, Machinegunner and Grenadier. These squads are the British Tommies, French Poilus, American Doughboys, and German Lansers. Theres also Raider squads, Reconnaissance squads, Heavy Defending squads and Specialist squads. The Raiders are the Canadians and Stosstruppen who use Gas attacks, Recons are the French Chausseurs Alpin and the German Alpenjaeger who use Air support. Defending squads are the Belgians and german Schutze who use precision heavy mortars. the Specialists are the USMC who use 30-06 French Chauchats and the M1897 Trench Gun, and the German Pioneers who use the Flamethrower and both call in Smokescreens and White Phosphorous attacks.Game modes: the Frontlines gamemode where the above mentioned set up is in play, and each team starts either defending a trenchline or going over the top to the enemy  trench line and the objective is to take or hold the trench, and if captured to defend against counter attacks. Rifle Deathmatch is a free for all mode where you choose a rifle and attachments and just play free for all.Attrition is a TDM that uses the squad system.And squad Coop  is when you enlist in a pals battalion with you and your friends and hold a trenchline against waves of attackers.I could go on even more than already on this game. I highly reccommend it especially for history buffs. The game definitely deserves 10/10

content:
20
												Verdun is a First Person Shooter game set during World War I. The developers have a large focus on authenticity with this game, trying to create an accurate representation of what it may have been like in the various brutal trenches and No Man's Lands of the conflict. In terms of gameplay, there are four different game modes that can be played with friends or solo. Frontlines is the main game mode where the objective is either to leave your (somewhat) safe trench and sprint across No Man's Land dodging gunfire and bombs into the enemy trench and capture it for your side or defend your trench from the attackers by sniping, calling mortar fire, using recon planes to spot enemies and using mount machine guns to mow down the numbers. One thing that many new players may dislike at first is that you WILL die. It more or less cannot be avoided in this game, although, I think it adds to the overall experience. This mode is awesome fun, especially with a four man squad of yourself and friends. The other modes include Attrition Warfare (which is effectively a Team Deathmatch mode), Squad Defense (a wave survival mode against bots than can be played with friends) and Rifle Deathmatch (a free for all gamemode). Squad Defense is pretty fun and can prove to be quite a challenge as you progress through the waves. The other two are pretty simple and if you have played TDM or FFA gamemodes before you know what to expect. The player can create a four man squad from a variety of different countries involved in the War, comprising of the Entente Side (Britain, Scotland, France, Canadian, American etc.) and the Central Powers Side (Germany). Both sides have different classes unique to certain countries, for example, the German "Pionere" Squad has a Flamethrower, other squads don't but have some other unique weapons or classes. One smart feature of the squads is when playing with the same players, the squad levels up and most of these squad ranks offer advantages like smaller cooldown times on abilities, different uniforms, longer hold breath time for sniping etc. There are still a few factions missing but they will probably be added in due time. The NCO of each squad can set a marker on areas to advance towards or defend as well as call in a mortar strike, a recon plane or a gas bomb on a highlighted area. However, only certain squad types will get to call in each attack which allows different squads being able to do numerous things for their allies. The gas attacks are just awesome, requiring anyone nearby to equip their gasmasks and hinder their visability. There are a variety of different weapons that can be used by the player. From the SMLE rifle to the MP18 machine gun to the trench clubs, spades and bayonets to the close quarters Trenchgun, there is so much choice and you will find that some weapons work way better on certain maps (snipers will be more useful in long, open No Man's Lands but may be harder to use in a close quarters, mazelike trench system). Nothing quite beats the adrenaline of driving a bayonet into someone's neck in a deep, muddy trench.The maps are very atmospheric and look like they have been completely modeled off of the photographs of the battlefields. These maps range from huge, open, crater-filled fields to deep and damp trenches. While there is a small number of maps, they are randomly selected so you are pretty much always playing on a different map.One thing that is specifically awesome is the extreme level of detail in the gory aspects of the war. Heads getting blown apart, bullets shatter skulls, grenades and bombs blow off limbs and flamethrowers leave a path of charred corpses behind. There are animations for various ways you can die. These animations, while can be glitchy, really create an intense atmosphere and are quite immersive. One example of this is while myself and another player were sniping, the other player was shot in the neck and fell backwards grasping his throat as blood spurted everywhere. That, paired with the distant screams and gunfire, created a fantastic, cinematic feeling.Technically, the game runs fairly well for me, only slightly dipping in fps at the start of a match. The online connectivity is relatively stable and I've only had one or two disconnects. The game feels pretty clunky at times and could probably be smoother, especially when you're having an intense melee battle with an enemy and you both look like foosball players in the process.Overall, the developers did a great job of creating an intense, authentic World War I experience and while it is clunky at times, it still is a great game for a World War I enthusiast.I recommend this game, especially if it's on sale.

content:
15, 2016
												So what is verdun? Well, for starters, its a ww1 infantry fps game, that mainly focuses on so called "trench warfare".And just to make it clear if it already wasent, when i say its trench warfare, and is a infantry fps game, i mean just that, there are no vehicels or any thing of the sort. The only thing that exists out side of the players equipment that it can use (like grenades,rifles and melee for example, that are directly used by the player), is the artillery strike which one (or more, i cant remember if there are mulitible classes that can do so) of the classes can call.The game is very immersive, and fairly true to the real thing (at least compared to video game standards), and all of the factions in the game, do actually use the rifles, pistols etc, that were used and manufactured by them. So the british use the lee enfield, and the germans use the .98 mauser for example. Which is to be expected from a historical game, but either way its in there.And as i mentioned before... The characthers are divided in to diffrent classes in small squads (kind of like in bf, but here the classes can only be occupied by one person at a time). and these classes have diffrent types of weaponry and perks to them, for example the grenadier can have up to four grenades on him, but then maybe just a little pistol as a primary, or you can be a machinegunner mowing down your enemys with for example a large lewis gun.The game has two game mods one which is basically just team deathmatch, so jsut running around in a trench and blasting eachother away, and then there is the bread and butter mode of the game. Which is a bit similar to almost something a bit like "Rush" form the battlefield franchies, but not really at all, but a nudge. But what you do is that either you start by attacking, which consits of you jumping out of your muddy, stinking, comforteble little trench and run out in to the "no mans land" and try to survive and take your self to the otehr side and then capture the enemys trench. Which is a lot easier said than done. And then if you succed in taking the trench, there will be a enemy counter attack, where the enemy try to take back their old trench through the same procedure as the attackers did.And here sadly the game starts lacking....The game is otherwise fairly well balanced and well patched at least i cant actually remeber myself rnning in to bugs while i played it).But the gameplay it self really lacks. Why? 1# the game is trying to be a realistic ww1 infantry shooter, and let me ask you, do you think it was very fun storming a trench? The answer is no. Most die, and so will you, over and over and over again, getting sniped by a sniper you dont see or mowed down by a mg, or maybe you get killed by morter, or maybe even gas if you dont throw on your gas mask quick enough. And when you finally think: "oh my god, im so close, i can even hear those ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s. And soon i will get my revenge for them killing me 30 times, and i will teabag them so much that from here on out they will be reminded of this very momnet". but then, you and your friend that are all cramped up in a little crater/foxhole, get blown up by one single well placed hand grenade.And the game is just really redundant to, because its the same thing over and over again, and the enviorment might change abit, but the experince is generally the same.And the combat isent to god either, since its really quite clunky, and grenade spammy once you get into the trench, and it mostly comes down to who is camping in the best spot.2# some of the classes are quite similar, which also contributes to the repetetiv nature of the game.I dont know what to say really, like the game has really lacking gameplay, but then again, its a almost one of a kind game, and there is not really any other game that offers the same experince. In the end maybe it isent really a bad game, just a game that wants to be historically accurate, and at the same time try to make one ofthe most brutal wars ever seen, feel enjoyble.But this is my opinion on the matter, are you just a general fan of fps games? You might want to skip this one. But if you are a person that wants to experince trench warfare, and a historically accurate game, and is generally intrested in history (specificly the first world war), then this is probably the best game to date to potray that.So the review will be positive, because its a game that offers a experince that almost no fps games do, and i to be honset cant come up with something like it that ive seen. Conclusion: The game has a very atmospheric feel to it and is well crafted immersive experince and can be quite fun at times when you get a equal amount of both sides of the gameplay that is offerd, that being to trench warfare, and the very intense and very punishing gameplay of the no mans land. A very unique game, But as most unique things, it is not for everyone.

content:
ry 29, 2016
												If you want WW1 trench combat, this is basically the only game you can get. Thankfully it's a good game. Classes feel mostly balanced and maps are mostly decent. There are obviously good maps and bad maps. The majority of the maps are good but some are still absolute stinkers (looking at you Fort Douaumont). Verdun feels mostly finished, but there are some things still missing such as only the British character models have gask masks, missing sounds, iffy netcode, reload animations don't sync with audio.. etc. It's all nit-picky stuff, apart from the netcode issue. The core gameplay is bug free and solid and I can only suggest a couple of improvements (i.e. one I really want is having an indicatior if your bolt isn't positioned correctly since the gun model always has a closed bolt even if the game thinks the bolt is open).I've been playing Verdun on both Windows and Linux and as expected, performance is utter trash on Linux. Maybe with some tweaking and better drivers the game will perform better, but bad performance is a common theme for me and games in Linux. Crashes are extremely frequent on Linux but I've never experienced a crash on Windows 10.

content:
, 2016
												This has become my go to game for any WW1 video game cravings as it is highly accurate to the historical time period and offers some very good graphics for the eye candy aspect.  The workings of the guns in this game impress me because of all the little details that go into working the gun, for example with the German Schutz  class Kar 98 sniper rifle with a scope the animation shows you having the gun move up as you cycle the bolt since they were not exactly light, straight pull bolts and needed some muscling to cycle them. The sounds and visual effects of the game help with immersion and I can easily play this game for hours without a regret. The general multiplayer community is actually decent and much better than a World of Tanks community for example. Most people aren't confrontational or accusing. Most people just play the game and avoid the world chat which is fine with me. As for lack of players, I haven't had a problem finding games though some of the other game modes besides Frontline can be sparse at times.However I feel the gameplay can feel a bit clunky at times and isn't as smooth as a Battlefield or COD game would be but I don't think it takes away too much from the enjoyability of the game. I think the game would benefit from a larger userbase and maybe smooth out the controls but otherwise I don't see any other problems that would bother me.

content:
2, 2016
												Verdun gets compared to Red Orchestra a lot and I think that this game would appeal to RO players. Verdun shares some of the weapons selection with RO but this game has a rigid pace and the guns are EXTREMELY lethal (once you get hit, you die and there is no saving you). And that's the fun of this game, it captures the WW1 trench warfare perfectly with the waves of men attacking at the sound of a whistle, the bleak hellish battlefield, and the things that made the battlefield so hellish like gas, machine fire mowing down soldiers, and barbed wire everywhere. The graphic and sound detail are top notch. There is lots of foilage without it hampering the performace, and the little audio details like the clanking of the soldier's gear while he runs is nice. My biggest gripe with this game are the menus and that they tend to make things harder to reach than it should be.The game runs at steady 60 fps for me at medium settings x 1080 on a GTX 750TI.

content:
6, 2015
												Fun bolt-action shooter that requires some patience to play and either quick reflexes or a good eye. Strongest part of the game is that it is very team-based; victory predicates on your team working together, not on kills. Guns are fun enough to shoot and have minor variations, but as all rifles are one shot kills, the only real differences are clip size, rate of fire, and sightings. Pistols are fun but useless at range, MG's are powerful and are excellent defensive weapons that must be setup to be useful. There is no need to worry about weapons overheating, however, so they can be a bit lacking in depth. Poison gas is a very cool element of this game and does a great job of mixing up a fight, bringing everyone into close-range shootouts and melees and blocking line of sight. Map selection is limited, but I do believe more are planned. Their individual quality is surprisingly good considering they are mostly made up of pot-holes and trenches. Performance wise Verdun runs OK but tends to have variable performance even on higher end systems with medium graphics settings. Overall a solid purchase for anything under $20. $23 is acceptable, but this is a game you know will go on sale for deep discounts.

								I've been waiting for a WWI FPS for years and this is the best that I've been able to find and for what it is right now, despite its flaws, it's pretty effing good.  I've always had a grim fascination with the Great War and think myself to be a bit of a buff.  The guns, classes, the desolation and destruction are all very well done.  The ambient noise (the shouting, the planes flying overhead) can be pretty eerie.  It is patched and updated fairly regularly and I can only see it getting better. One of the best things about it?  From what I've seen, the people who play it/that I've played with are some of the nicest I've encountered in a long time.  That could be worth the price of the game itself.I wish only the absolute best for the Verdun team.  Buy the game.

content:
14
												I first played Verdun when it was in its early stages, the only gameplay available was rifle death match. Even though I was not all too good, I loved the game. When I found it on Steam, getting it was a no brainer. I love this game even more now than I did then. However, this game is not for everyone. If you can't handle dying constantly then you have no business playing Verdun. In Verdun (at least for me) you are dead for just about as much time as you are alive. The weapons it this game are not "Call of Duty" type guns either, you can't just go in guns blazing or you will be dying A LOT. However, if you love WWI games or just games that feature fast paced trench warfare, then Verdun is the game for you. The maps are detailed and expansive, as well as difficult. With all this being said, I would strongly recommend that you get this game, it is very fun. If your not sure about whether or not you would like this game, I know YouTube has a good amount of gameplays and tutorials you can watch. I hope you get this game, and I hope to see you on the frontlines!

content:
8, 2016
												Alright, here goes another review.I like this game. It is immersive, besides a few glitches here and there, but still pretty cool. I am going to steer clear of the word simulator though.The variations of squads is cool. You have squads for punching through the line, squads for recon, squads for clearing out the trenches. Along with these squads comes with a variation of rifles, pistols, grenades, and equipment. Some of these squads also have Machine gun units as well as Sub Machine gun units. Very nice.The uniforms are nice too. They look worn just as they would after a battle.Although this game is pretty good, it is no where near perfect. In fact, it almost seemes like the devs abandoned the PC version of this game and went in search for gold in the new world of next gen consoles. I'm not sure if I can entirely recomend this game for PC but it seems okay for the next gen. Keep in mind, this is my opinion, and I think the game is good. If you enjoy war games that immerse you as this one does, then you should get it, though I would recomend geting it on a sale. Hope I catch you in game!

content:
2, 2015
												Verdun is a great game that hits that sweet spot between realism and annoying ease. The squad system makes the game unique and encourages you to build relationships with the people you're playing with. Unlike most FPS games, there's a lot of patience and tactics that go into attacking AND defending, and if you don't like to wait around, you may not like this game. However, if you have a group of friends who enjoys squad play, this is a great game to get.The biggest downside to the game is the lack of player base; I would also like to see some different game modes, and I hope to see those in the future. At $22, it's a fair price. On sale, it's a steal.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
er 31, 2014
Early Access Review
								Verdun is absolutely amazing for an alpha. The game demonstrates trench warfare perfectly, while the whistle blows I'd hop over the trench and charge the enemy under machine gun fire. Once in the trench, the enemy would drop gas and I'd put my gas mask on. Then my squad and I would take the trench and prepare to charge for the next one. It makes me feel like I'm actually there. This game is entirley unique because, sadly, there are barely any fps set in WW1 out right now. Some cons about the game are the fps. I have a high-end gaming rig and I still manage to get 20-40 fps depending on the map. I know this is still in alpha but I'd like it fixed. Some things I'd like to see in the game are aerial dogfights, and more gore. I think it would look awesome to look up and see planes firing at eachother. But I would definetly like to see more blood and gore the most. It would be more immersive to be pinned down in a blood filled with guts flying everywhere, considering how brutal and rutheless WW1 was. Overall, I do recommend this game in it's current state. I'm sure the devs will fix the fps issue and add more content later on. I rate 8/10.

content:
, 2015
												I will just tell you who reads this about how I feel about this whole game. I wont be talking about classes and how the game runs, just how it feels for me.So. You sit there in the trench, taking pot shots at the germans on the other side of the no mans land. Your whole squad around you, you got to know them over the training and battles you been in so far. You feel in your gut that sitting in this trench wont be and that you and your friends have to brave death once again.First its the French, the whistle is blown and they storm out of the trench shouting and swearing as machinegun fire and rifle fire destroys their advance. Only their bodies left in the mud. You take a deep breath and as your corporal blows the whistle you rush out from the trench and into no mans land. You run, screaming and shouting with the rest as members of other squads fall around you, luckily the bullets seem to evade just you. You throw yourself in a nearby ditch, picked by the corporal as a rally point. You turn around as see no other in your squad and you assume the worst. Steeling yourself you stand up and run into yet again. No mans land.

content:
3, 2015
												Finally a good World War 1 game! Experience the great war with all the bolt action, trench warfare, chemical weapon fighting you want! As of this review there are a deathmatch and Front lines. The Front lines game mode requires a little bit more explaining. I am going to quote the wiki here for you guys new to the game. "Frontlines is the most popular type of match played in Verdun. It is a competition between two teams, one French and one German. Each team has up to sixteen players. Each team is divided into squads of up to four players. The teams alternate between offense and defense ("Attack" vs "Defend"). While on offense the team can score a point by capturing the next trench. If the defending team is able to successfully defend their trench from the attack, then they earn a point. The match ends when one team controls the entire map or the timer runs out. "There is a lot of detail put into Verdun, but it does have a small playerbase at the moment. The game itself reminds me a bit of the Red Orchestra games in a World War 1 setting. Overall I have got to say I really recommend Verdun, its just got what it takes to be a great game!

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
, 2016
												This has become my go to game for any WW1 video game cravings as it is highly accurate to the historical time period and offers some very good graphics for the eye candy aspect.  The workings of the guns in this game impress me because of all the little details that go into working the gun, for example with the German Schutz  class Kar 98 sniper rifle with a scope the animation shows you having the gun move up as you cycle the bolt since they were not exactly light, straight pull bolts and needed some muscling to cycle them. The sounds and visual effects of the game help with immersion and I can easily play this game for hours without a regret. The general multiplayer community is actually decent and much better than a World of Tanks community for example. Most people aren't confrontational or accusing. Most people just play the game and avoid the world chat which is fine with me. As for lack of players, I haven't had a problem finding games though some of the other game modes besides Frontline can be sparse at times.However I feel the gameplay can feel a bit clunky at times and isn't as smooth as a Battlefield or COD game would be but I don't think it takes away too much from the enjoyability of the game. I think the game would benefit from a larger userbase and maybe smooth out the controls but otherwise I don't see any other problems that would bother me.

content:
28, 2016
												One of my few serious reviews. Pros: WW1, very few people do this. They did it right Good graphics, I like all the graphics they are great and very well textured and thought out. I like that a lot. Player to map size is great, although I do want one more squad per map, I feel some maps such as Pircade are a little under populated and not very fun. One more squad would fix that. Wide range of map choices. From hills to forrest, to a fortress. I like that, I like that a lot. Great gunplay, I like how the guns feel and look. They fire accuratley if you hold down shift while looking down. Also when aiming down sight due to your player breathing the scope and gun will move so make sure to shift when aiming down sights when you are about to fire, makes it a lot easier. NO DLCS, yes this is a PLUS. I am sick of paying for a DLC, I hate them. Excluding EU4 dlcs. But Verdun offers so much when it comes to the one time buy. No pay to win, all skill based which is grea too. I am very glad they do not have a DLC. If they do add a DLC I would hope they add the Eastern front as a DLC for 20 dollars I think is a fair price. New maps, guns and factions for that is what I would 100% buy. The gore update is great, I love losing my leg, arm or whatever to a bomb, bullet or nade. I like this a lot. Great sounds, very nice Neutral I am neutral to the player size, as I said one more squad would be a lot better. The maps although good are a bit lacking in some areas but still great. Wish they were more trench like, where you can pier over the side without exposing half your body. Selection of joining a match is good, which they added how much time is left. I hate joining my favorite map and in 30s the round ends, wish they added a timer in the selection menu. Filtering out certain squads. I know you can choose your own however it would be a nice touch to add an ability to filter out certain squads such as Canadians, U.S Marines, etc. Cons: Communication is the worst I have ever seen. No voice, or at least voice that is useful. They need to add localized voice chat, squad chat and squad leader chat to allow squad leads to talk to each other as well as squad members to talk to each other and localized proxy chat. No one reads chat, no one. It takes too long to type in combat and over all the worst I've seen in a game that requires fast paced action. An example of just 30 minutes ago I was in a match in the fort and a German sat in a corner and fired at everyone who ran by. I saw him. However almost everyone went right by him every time. I was talking in team chat and NO ONE payed attention to it. Also those goes for ALL players pay attention to chat please. No campgain however this is a multiplayer game that is expected but if they did add a DLC a campaign would be nice as either German, Americans, French or British would be a great 20 dollar addon that I would buy easily. No rewarding upgrades, I use mostly stock guns because they are so good so for players like me who have a good amount of time in no rewarding guns in higher up levels are any good. Excluding MG and Greandier. Can be a bit glitchy. My other complaint about gore is that you cannot shoot a dead body and it splat blood, I wish you could do that. OverallYes this is a good game, I would recommend buying it for 25 it is worth it, at FULL price. I got this for cheap on sale so I was very lucky and it has TON of replay ability. The devs constanly update it adding a ton of things. Gore is great. I would rate this 8/10. Worth a buy? Yes.

content:
, 2016
												French faction is in a game made by indie developers. DICE/EA Have millions but will put them for DLC. But honestly, this game is great. Sure at times it may be glitchy and clunky but my god, the gameplay is actually so much superior than battlefield/COD.... And its a ww1 game. There is more of an emphasis on flanking the enemy and lining up your shot with your bolt action rifle. Every bullet counts. You even have to look at the enemy's uniform to see if they are with you.The landscape,gore,sound effects and attention to detail for the era really highlight the horrors of the Battle of Verdun. Try to have a few friends with this game and enjoy. Yet this game appeals to many people- casuals, arma players and people in between and everyone seems to enjoy it. My fav game at the moment for sure

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
er 31, 2016
												If you're a fan of World War I or of squad based tactical gameplay in general, Verdun is definitely a game worth owning. It's a historically rooted game that display's the horrors of the First World War while allowing you to participate in the full scale battles that many of these men had fought through. Pros
 Real WWI Experience for fans of its history Fast paced gameplay in some areas while maintaining tactical gameplay at other times Intense combat for crazy in-game moments Good amount of classes, squads, weapons, and a variety of other things Maps that throw players into many different scenarios for new experiences Has Replay Value Cons
 Small server population sizes at certain times in the day Ping is high for many far from the source Spawnkilling WILL happen in many cases A lack of tutorial mode or of other better game modes other that Frontlines Squad setup and game finding is slightly frustrating at times No shortage of bugs and glitchesDespite the flaws that are pointed out, this game is still a good experience for those who are willing to play with friends and work together to achieve an ultimate goal as one. Would recommend.

content:
r 10, 2016
												Verdun is honestly one of the funnest games I've played. It feels different to a lot of other FPS games, not only in the theme but in the gameplay mechanics too. I particularly enjoy the NCO role in squads giving access to command auras and abilities such as mortar strikes, smoke screens, air recon, and gas attacks.It's very fun to play and has a few different gameplay types although I spend a vast majority of my time in the frontlines type in which you fight for control of enemy trenches.The weapons are very fun to use and I feel there is a good and interesting variety, with the vastly different fire rates of weapons, along with the different requirements of no man's land and trench fighting, I feel there is a lot of tactical thinking that can go into gameplay and deciding how and when to take your battles.I really enjoy the team focused elements of the game and I feel that the Verdun community is one of the friendliest and more welcoming communities in online games that I've experienced.Progressing, gaining ranks, medals, etc. All of that is nice as well and gives a real sense of achievement and I often screenshot the scoreboard and my medals when I've done particularly well, and looking at the screenshots in the community hub, I'm not alone in doing this.All in all, it's a very wonderful, sure there is the occasional bug but I feel the developers are pretty good at fixing these and I wouldn't say they impact gameplay much at all.I would definitely recommend Verdun!

content:
8, 2015
												I layed down holding my rifle tightly as I watched my friends being shredded by enemy fire. We were attempting to take a trench ontop of a hill that ws very important for the battle. I had not yet been spottd for i was laying down in a patch of tall, thick grass. I was about tn feet from the east side of the trench. The trench sprawled to the west for another 100 feet or more. I saw an enemy infantryman behind a tree to my left diagonaly about 10 feet away, him being right infront of the trench. He was facing the other direction. I saw my chance and I took it. I sprinted up to the side of him and pushedd my bayonet as hard as I could Into his side. He died instantly. I then proceeded to run into the trench and crouch down. I saw an enemy about 20 feet awaying coming my way through the trenches. I then layed down and pointed my rifle at the exact possition I was going to shoot him at. I saw him come out and I fired and watched as his lifeless body hit the ground. I stood up and ran, but before I knew what was going on, it was too late. I ran passed an enemy MG and he opened fir on me and I was torn to peices and hit the floor. I Sat there watching as my allies stormed the place. I realized that not only had I sacrificed myself for my team, but also caused a distraction just long enough for my men to take the trench. thats all I thought about as a faded into the after life. Then I respawne and did it again.

content:
6, 2015
												Fun bolt-action shooter that requires some patience to play and either quick reflexes or a good eye. Strongest part of the game is that it is very team-based; victory predicates on your team working together, not on kills. Guns are fun enough to shoot and have minor variations, but as all rifles are one shot kills, the only real differences are clip size, rate of fire, and sightings. Pistols are fun but useless at range, MG's are powerful and are excellent defensive weapons that must be setup to be useful. There is no need to worry about weapons overheating, however, so they can be a bit lacking in depth. Poison gas is a very cool element of this game and does a great job of mixing up a fight, bringing everyone into close-range shootouts and melees and blocking line of sight. Map selection is limited, but I do believe more are planned. Their individual quality is surprisingly good considering they are mostly made up of pot-holes and trenches. Performance wise Verdun runs OK but tends to have variable performance even on higher end systems with medium graphics settings. Overall a solid purchase for anything under $20. $23 is acceptable, but this is a game you know will go on sale for deep discounts.

												Verdun is a great game that hits that sweet spot between realism and annoying ease. 												I first played Verdun when it was in its early stages, the only gameplay available was rifle death match. Even though I was not all too good, I loved the game. When I found it on Steam, getting it was a no brainer. I love this game even more now than I did then. However, this game is not for everyone. If you can't handle dying constantly then you have no business playing Verdun. In Verdun (at least for me) you are dead for just about as much time as you are alive. The weapons it this game are not "Call of Duty" type guns either, you can't just go in guns blazing or you will be dying A LOT. However, if you love WWI games or just games that feature fast paced trench warfare, then Verdun is the game for you. The maps are detailed and expansive, as well as difficult. With all this being said, I would strongly recommend that you get this game, it is very fun. If your not sure about whether or not you would like this game, I know YouTube has a good amount of gameplays and tutorials you can watch. I hope you get this game, and I hope to see you on the frontlines!

content:
er 31, 2014
Early Access Review
								Verdun is absolutely amazing for an alpha. The game demonstrates trench warfare perfectly, while the whistle blows I'd hop over the trench and charge the enemy under machine gun fire. Once in the trench, the enemy would drop gas and I'd put my gas mask on. Then my squad and I would take the trench and prepare to charge for the next one. It makes me feel like I'm actually there. This game is entirley unique because, sadly, there are barely any fps set in WW1 out right now. Some cons about the game are the fps. I have a high-end gaming rig and I still manage to get 20-40 fps depending on the map. I know this is still in alpha but I'd like it fixed. Some things I'd like to see in the game are aerial dogfights, and more gore. I think it would look awesome to look up and see planes firing at eachother. But I would definetly like to see more blood and gore the most. It would be more immersive to be pinned down in a blood filled with guts flying everywhere, considering how brutal and rutheless WW1 was. Overall, I do recommend this game in it's current state. I'm sure the devs will fix the fps issue and add more content later on. I rate 8/10.

content:
4, 2016
												The game is very similar to Red Orchestra II, as it consists of holding and attacking cap points within the game. It is also similar in its realism. One shot with a bolt action rifle will kill you, while the game makes you reload each individual bullet into your rifles. It's not fast paced like BF or Call of Duty, this game is much more realistic and hardcore. It's unforgiving, relentless, but very rewarding if you have the patience to learn the maps, work together as a team, and figure out the different weapons. Right now there are eight maps on Frontlines, which is the main game mode where you attack and defend positions. There are several squads to choose from, such as Americans, Canadians, Belgians or French. Each squad has its own unique classes such as sharpshooters or machinegunners. Weapon upgrades can be unlocked using experience points gained within the game. I highly recommend this game. It's a good alternative to arcade shooters like Battlefield or Call of Duty, and essentially the only WWI shooter out right now. 10/10 would WWI again.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
, 2016
												If you get this game expecting Call of Duty or Battlefield, turn back now. This is not a run and gun type of game. Sure, sometimes you will find yourself running into an enemy trench with your guns blazing, but not often. Employ tactics one use in most modern shooters and you will find youself dead very quickly. And even if you are super careful, you will die a lot. You will move carefully between cover, utilizing shellholes and other defenses to make your way to the enemy trench. Any second you might be seen and shot at. You are just meters from the enemy trench, and you are preparing to make your charge in an attempt to help capture it. A shot flies past you and you duck behind the nearest cover, cowering as bullets fly overhead as the enemy tries to nail you. In a few seconds the bullets stop, and you rise again to rush into the trench. This is it, this is your chance to kill some enemies and establish a foothold for your teammates to exploit. You rush into the trench with your rifle at the ready and are swiftly cut down by an enemy who was lying in wait. You respawn, and you get to do it all over again!It actually is a really fun game. This isnt a game about k/d ratios. Its about teamwork. Without teamwork, your team will likely lose. Thankfully, unlike some other games, this game rewards teamwork. For example, each squad has a team leader. The rest of the team can spawn on him, so a good team leader will sneak up close to the enemy trench and then hide, letting his squad spawn in really close to the frontlines. He wont rush in guns blazing, because he will likely die quickly and not be there for his squad to spawn in on him. If you are willing to put the team and the objective above your own stats, you will love this game. If not, I suggest moving on.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
er 26, 2016
												Take the excellent shooting mechanics that Call of Duty developed over a decade, add a dash of realism, the crisp graphics of this year's latest shooter, and base it around a game where team work and cooperation is vital and you have Verdun.This generation's answer to the big-budget, big explosion shooter, Verdun goes back to the roots of historical shooters by offering dozens of period accurate bolt-action rifles and cutting back on the pyro-technics and kill streaks. Verdun isn't without its explosions though as every new player will find out when they are on the receiving end of a massive creeping artillery barrage that forces them to hug the dirt and claw over thier squadmates to find a safe place to hide.Being historically based this game focuses less on team balancing, certain nations just have benefits. The allies will have a better time being on the receiving end of a gas attack as their masks have large single pane lenses, while the German's are forced to use lenses held together by solder, obscuring vision even more. However, the Allies, often have rifles and machine guns that lagged behind some of the cutting edge weaponry of the Germans (including flamethrowers, box fed machineguns, and a high-caliber anti-tank rifle).My personal favourite ascpect of the game is the reliance on teamwork, you wiil actually get to know people you play with. Kill/death ratio amount for such a small amount of the score that they are almost irrelevant. A player can have almost no kills but be the highest scoring player in the match because they supported thier team and took the most ground.If you want a shooter with great graphics and sound, historical accuracy (for a game), and are looking for a cooperative experience, this is for you.

content:
1, 2014
Early Access Review
								Verdun. A game that describes the first World War, this is a truly amazing game even though its in beta, this is definitely a game worth you´r money when its on sale and when its on its base price, the battles moving from the Fields of Flanders, Picardie, to the forests of Argoness, attacking and defending on the map from you´r trenches to the enemy, this game has smartly implented combat like in World War 1, on the maps there´re muiltple layers of defense line with cordinated defense making it almost impenetrable. i recommend this game anyone who like realistic first person shooters what requirs teamwork and good cordination, this is surely a great game for anyone who likes both World Wars, the negative things are not many in my opinion, this game is definitely misssing a report button as i saw people with numerious buthurt comments, also a clan option would be nice as this is a game about teamwork, the prone and crouch movements should be lowerd as it more feels like a cod game with the movements, this is overall a great game and i give personly 8,5/10 from what the beta already has to offer8,5/10 a good game i you have money to spare

content:
28, 2015
Early Access Review
								Sitting in my trench listening to everyone yelling at each other, hearing shot's land too close to my position I move down the line. Next thing I know chlorine gas explodes on my positon and i hear the pitter patter of at least a squad of men coming towards my position. I slip on my gas mask while listening to my squad get wiped out, out of nowhere two whole squads of germans coming charging in down the trench with their mace's and bayonet's swinging away. I yell holy ♥♥♥♥ and proceed to run away while hip firing my Lewis gun at the charging Schnitzel's, as i start to change my magazine while still being chased I realised I had loss track of two of the charging men and then out of nowhere two German's coming flying into the trench in front of me and proceed to bash my skull in with their maces.10/10 would be slaughtered again

content:
ber 24, 2014
HighlightsOne of the most intense and realistic FPS set in an historical era, in this case the unexplored World War I. It has the perfect combination of realism and acion, giving us something close to Red Orchestra. It features big maps inspired by historical battlefields, a good amount of weapons, and a lot of different squads, each one with 4 soldiers with their unique habilities.Pros:-Realistic, and an extreme attention to details-Immersive (among the best voice acting I've ever seen)-Good variety of weapons, squads, maps...Cons:-It's really hard to get used to this game. One hit kills, and it can lead to frustration-The squad exp system is interesting, but punishes solo players (a little bit)
